main event: A civilian observed an unidentified object west of Dayton, Ohio moving westward towards the moon on January 7, 1957.
interesting points: The object was reported to the Dayton Civil Defense, who then relayed the information to the ATIC (Air Technical Intelligence Center).
A radar check was conducted but only an aircraft about 30 miles west of Dayton was detected, with no other objects on the radar.
The object was described as an astronomical object, bright with rays.
The sighting was determined to be the star Sirius.
The observer stated the object looked like distant helicopters or may have been some type of light or night object.
sighted object: An unidentified bright object with rays
